over what is currently happening within the environment. So how many
ongoing chats? How many bot chats? How many open chats? You know were

That's created by for the current day again would be visible and then we

along, we can see summaries by agent or team level where you will be

# AA Overview
## Agent Transfer Node
## Queue Tags / Team Routing
## Agent Views
## Re-initiate Chat via Templates
## Canned Responses & Attachments
## Rewrite/Expand/Rephrase
## Chat Summary

## User Details Panel
Hi, welcome to a short overview over agent assist. Now in your chats
that you are building on the Gupshup Journey Builder, you are able to
actually go ahead and connect a user to an agent at any point during the
interaction, during whichever node that you wish to go ahead and lead to
an agent.

## Agent Transfer Node
You can simply click the add button, go under actions, and one of the nodes is the agent transfer node. The same node can be accessed
by menu on the left where you have the agent transfer node available. If
you want to pass on any parameters, you will be able to go ahead and

## Queue Tags / Team Routing
provide tags to help with the queuing of the particular chat to the
right team. Now once we're done with this, we move on to the agent
assist part where under chats we are able to actually see any chats that
have been assigned to users.

## Agent Views
You can create views which will allow
agents to go ahead and filter and see the relevant chats accordingly.
Now if a chat has ended,

## Re-initiate Chat via Templates
the agent does have the choice to reinitiate a
chat by sending a template. These templates can be approved as per your
requirement. There are only the relevant ones visible to the agents to
send across. Once I click on send template, the message would be sent to
the user who once replies is where the chat would become active. So here
we will just simply have the user respond to the chat, and as you can
see over here, the user has gone ahead and said "hello" and the chat is
active. Now there are a lot of interesting things you can do in a chat.

## Canned Responses & Attachments
If you hit the slash key, you will be able to go ahead and use the
canned responses which can be used to quickly get the message across to
the user without the agent having to type them. The agents can actually
provide attachments to be sent across. They will be able to add smileys
to the response, and all of these options are optional. Of course, they
can do audio notes, and they are able to go ahead and send users across
to a bot journey as well. Now apart from that, the response itself is
something that the agents can go ahead and finesse a little by either

## Rewrite/Expand/Rephrase
pressing the expand key, which will quickly make the message a bit more
finessed than it was otherwise. There's also an option to rephrase which
can provide you alternate views of how the message can be written
instead. Now before I actually send the message, I might want to know
what actually was happening in the previous conversation. And that's
where the

## Chat Summary
chat summary is something that can help the agent understand
the customer's purpose. If there were bot responses, it will be able to
summarize the same, and agent responses as well. On the right-hand side,

## User Details Panel
the agents should be able to see details about the user, including their
number, their email, and other details that are relevant as a part of
the account. And that, ladies and gentlemen, is the short and sweet
overview of the Agent Assist module.
# AA settings
## User & Team Management
## Productivity & Chat Tools

## Account & Auth Settings
Hello, everyone. In today's session, we'll be getting a glimpse of the
agent assist settings section. The agent assist comes with a range of
powerful settings that can help businesses manage their customer support
needs effectively and efficiently. In order to master the agent assist
and utilize the maximum efficiency of this particular offering that we
have, there is an overview dashboard that is provided for project owners
and admins. To start off with the basics of agent assist, which includes

## Queue Tags / Team Routing
how to build a team, how to have a user management configuration done,
how do we navigate chats in an efficient manner, what kind of metrics
and dashboards do we provide to the customers, and how do you increase
or maintain your team's performance by analyzing this dashboard as well
as setting up certain router appliance for increasing the efficiency of
your agents. There are major configurations that are also present on an
overview. So based on the business goals and requirements, we can
configure these as well in a very quick fashion. Now, towards the left
hand side, we have the rest of the components which includes assignment
rules, chat rules, agent status, scan responses, views, chat fields,
feedback forms, etc., which are gathered into separate modules over here
for better understanding and analysis and setups. Now, with the user
management module, we'll be able to invite the users, edit and delete
users, add users, etc., based on the new passwords and everything. So we
can add those users which are created to a particular team based on a
region, based on time zones, based on subject matter expertise, etc..
Any kind of agent status that is required, for example, if a person is
available right now, unavailable, busy, etc., can be configured, and you
can create---these are some of the system default ones---but you can
also create a new status request according to your requirements.
Automations work efficiently with respect to the agent assist
environment. So, how does with assignment rules, businesses can specify
conditions for assigning chats to agents in a particular fashion. With
chat rules, can be used to prioritize and tag incoming chats. Any kind
of auto replies that needs to be configured or feedback that needs to be
provided from the customer's side, etc., can also be configured directly
on the environment. So there are multiple different options that are
available which will benefit the process of how the automation can be
done and how efficiently the tags can be managed. We've also introduced
journey triggers. So from a particular agent side, we can trigger an
entire journey if that configuration is available. Next, we have
productivity tools wherein we are able to manage the different view

## Agent Views
options that are there which helps agents to access chats of a specific
category in a dedicated bucket.

## User Details Panel
We also have chat fields which are
configurable which can be used to store qualitative data about these
chats. It can be with respect to information about the customer that can
be useful in providing a resolution in a faster way. We also have SLAs
which are used to set targets for agents and improve productivity of the
agents where you can have different combination of notifications,
triggers, metrics, etc., that can be configured. The feedback forms that
we have allow businesses to collect valuable feedback from the
customers. So we have gone through the entire workflows and automation
part of that. We have recently introduced the AI management module where

## Rewrite/Expand/Rephrase
the customer---the agent---has an option to rephrase the text that they
have,

## Chat Summary
expand and summarize it according to the requirements, and the
co-pilot option also helps in sending suggested responses and generating
responses, etc. The account manager configurations ideally helps with
creating authenticated environments. If we have to enable SSO for all
our agents or login IDs for two-step authentication, etc.. Webhooks for
specific events that can be triggered where chat can be triggered, any
kind of API configurations that needs to be done to push information
into a particular environment. We have all the password policies that
can be set up as well. So how do we manage all these accounts, which
channel have been hosted this on, etc., can be configured from the
account settings page. So with these powerful settings, businesses can
now streamline their entire process, whether it is customer support,
sales, etc., and provide quick and efficient support to their customers.
So that's for the session. Thank you so much.

# AI Admin
Hi there and welcome to Gupshup Academy. Today we will be looking at the
latest features of AI Admin. So whenever you want to create an
Artificial Intelligence workspace, we click on Bot Studio and then we
navigate to AI Admin. Over here first of all all of your previous
workspaces are visible, so either you can click and edit any one of

## Workspace & NLU Management
these or you can also click on Create a new workspace from scratch. Now
I have just for the sake of demo, I already have one workspace created
over here, so let\'s walk through this. Over here we have five to six
tabs seven to eight tabs and then we can also change this workspace,
rename it and click on save. Then just to explain these tabs, intent is
something intent basically refers to an action that a person would like
to perform. Say for example a person saying I want to book a hotel room
in Delhi for two people on this particular date. So booking a hotel is
an intent and all the property values mapped to that particular intent
like which hotel, which particular date, how many rooms, how many
people, all this is referred to as entities. So an intent is an action
and all the properties related to that intent are referred to as
entities. You can click on Create intent, you can give it a description
and then you can also generate utterances which is being generated by
AI. So if at all I write I want to book a flight and click on Generate
utterances, it basically will generate multiple types of examples in
which I can ask to book a flight. Then there\'s one as soon as you train
something in the content section, one intent by itself gets created by
its own, which is referred to as FAQ. So if at all you\'re creating an
FAQ bot, you don\'t have to create intent for FAQ. It\'s already there
by default. If at all I click on entities, over here you can create
entities which are mapped to those intents. So if at all I click on
Create, I can give it a name and description and then I can map the
intent to which I want to to whichever I want to map it to. Say for
example in additional parameters I can also enter sample values or
alternative values just for better training. So that is also a
possibility.

## Content Training & Scrapers
If at all I click on Content tab, this is where you can train the AI workspace in multiple formats. So either you can also click
on any one of these URLs, click on Enter and click on Save and train.
You can also define to what extent do you want to scrape this URL to. Do
you only want to get it trained on the provided page or should it be
unlimited depth or should it be only seven pages. You can also train it
in the by train it in the form of PDF, TXT and CSV files as well. Or you
can also put out text input. So in this case just for example I\'ve
trained it on short input on some text on based on Indian heritage. Okay
and I have trained it. Teach this is where you can teach your bot
multiple utterances just for better training. So just to explain this
particular concept, say for example there\'s a new joiner in your
office, in that case you can you train them by you know telling them
that in various types of situation examples ways a question can be
asked, right? So teach is nothing but that. So if at all I click on
Teach sample, this is a a sample CSV file in which you can train the bot
on sample utterances. So you can simply give it a question number, you
can give it a name and you can also map the intent around it and you can
also map the entities around it. So this is very less used but still
there\'s an option for it just so that you can train it by uploading a
CSV.

## Evaluation & LLM Settings
Then we also have Evaluate. So if at all you train the workspace on
any content, so you can also evaluate just and this is basically the
evaluation of accuracy. So this is one of the workspaces that I already
created. So if at all you click on Generate Q&A via prompt, over here
you can simply enter the prompt that tell me about the stock market
course. So it will generate five to ten whatever the number of question
count you enter over here, it will generate those number of questions.
You can then refer to those questions and decide whether the accuracy of
this workspace is acceptable or not. So say for example I click on this,
this is a these are a few set of question and answers that I got
generated just to define the accuracy of of my training. Over here I can
refer to all these questions and I can define whether this is acceptable
or not. Then we also have settings with regards to AI Admin. So I\'ll
switch back to this tab. We also have settings, so if at all I click on
Edit settings, I can also export and import entities and intents. Which
is again very less widely used but we still have a functionality for
that. So all these intents these are majorly created through the intent
tabs and entity tabs but they can also be exported or imported. Then you
can also enter workspace instructions for answers whether these should
whether many emojis should be used or not used, whether the answer type
should be short or long things like that. And then we also have LLM
configurations for responses. So if at all I click on this, there are
the four versions wherein we are using different combinations of open
LLM APIs just to create different types of workspaces. And then we also
have setting up selection of answer type whether it should be short or
long and then we also have precision threshold wherein you can define
how confident the bot should feel before it answers any question. Say
for example if at all this precision threshold is switched to 90 and you
ask an agent a question, in that case the agent will not respond to that
question until and unless it is 90% sure about about the answer. So it
is that\'s why it is generally kept around 30 just so that the bot does
not become too much strict. And then we also have language settings and
then in developer settings, this is where we have a workspace
configurator just for additional flexibility.

## AI Agent Configuration (Personality/Skills)
And then finally the this is one of the newest features in AI Admin, which is the AI agent tab.
This was previously in beta and now available on console. So over here
you can now create your own custom AI agents workspaces by yourself. So
we have four tabs in these AI agents. Okay first of all you give it a
personality, if at all I click on Edit, you can give it a name, you can
choose the behavior whether it should be professional and positive,
clever and playful, respectful and persuasive or empathetic and
supportive. So whatever is whatever suits your use case best, you can
select any one of these. And then you can also choose the language style
whether it should be straightforward, sophisticated or technical. And
then whether the bot agent should use ok emoticons frequently or never
or occasionally. In this case I\'ll say frequently. And then you can
also set up a custom greeting message. This is the first message that
the AI agent will send whenever a customer says hi to it. Now in the
second tab this this is where all the use case orchestration in done for
AI agents. In my skills if at all I click on Edit, you can give it a
name again and then you can give it a description wherein you can enter
describe your use case in very short words and then the AI will generate
utterances for itself. So in this case I say you are an FAQ agent which
helps users by answering queries based on Indian history. Okay as soon
as I click Generate instructions, skill objective, engagement rules,
guardrails, tools, this is these are all the tabs were filled by the
agent itself according to my intent, according to my description. Now
again I can click on any one of these and I can review all the prompts
that the AI agent wrote for itself. And then I can tweak if at all I
think there might be any changes required in any of these prompts, then
I can do that. In a very simple language I can also enter all the
instructions that I want. Say for example I can say always answer in a
very humble manner, right? So in just in similar ways wherein you
communicate with your friends, you can simply write give instructions in
the prompt editor to the AI workspace. There\'s no strict format that
has to be followed. So just to walk through this as well. In skill
objective you can actually give the agent its personality what actually
who actually the agent is. In engagement rules you can actually define
in what manner should the agent engage with the end users, right? And
then we also have tools wherein any kind of operation that needs to be
performed, that is done via tools. So in structured journeys we do API
integrations and in AI agents we have tools, okay? So tools are
equivalent of API integrations. So you can write any tool to perfo

agent its personality what actually
who actually the agent is. In engagement rules you can actually define
in what manner should the agent engage with the end users, right? And
then we also have tools wherein any kind of operation that needs to be
performed, that is done via tools. So in structured journeys we do API
integrations and in AI agents we have tools, okay? So tools are
equivalent of API integrations. So you can write any tool to perform any
kind of a function, say for example you\'re collecting some information
and you want to send it to some CRM, a tool can be used to do that. So
and let\'s also see how it is used. In this case I\'ve written use
\@get_faq_answer_tool to fetch answers from the training data. So this
tool basically performs this particular function that it makes the AI
agent fetch answers from the training data. I can also say use
\@search_api to fetch answers from the open web in case not found in the
training data. So any any kind of instructions related to tools can be

wherein you can define the goal of the agent as well. So if at all I
click on edit, this particular workspace will get saved. Now
additionally we also have we also have a separate tab for tools. So
these are the few tools that have been generated by default. Then I can
also click on add tool, give it a description and we also have a a UI
wherein you can enter the API endpoints and write the code for it. So
any kind of use cases which requires any custom development on tools,
that can also be done through the console itself. And then finally we
have settings wherein we have four four options over here. So this is
where all the LLM configuration can be done and we can or this is where
we can also fine tune how our AI model generates responses by generating
key parameters like max tokens, temperature or top P. First of all we
have models so wherein we have two options, GPT-4O or GPT-4O mini. And
then we have max tokens, temperature and top P. So max tokens basically
set the max tokens setting controls the length of the AI responses. So
basically a higher value allows a longer more detailed answers while a
lower value keeps the responses short and to the point. And over here
the limit is set to 1000 which means that this particular AI can
generate fairly detailed replies within that particular limit. Then for
temperature this basically influences the randomness of the AI\'s
response. So a lower value like 0.1 makes the AI more predictable and
factual and basically it makes sure that it is sticking closely to the
known information. And a higher temperature closer to one maybe makes
responses more creative and a little varied. Okay then we also have top
P this basically controls how diverse the

ly detailed replies within that particular limit. Then for
temperature this basically influences the randomness of the AI\'s
response. So a lower value like 0.1 makes the AI more predictable and
factual and basically it makes sure that it is sticking closely to the
known information. And a higher temperature closer to one maybe makes

# Automated Campaign manager
## Creating Automated Campaigns
## Date-based Triggers (Reminders)
## Event-based Triggers (Integrations)

## Segment-driven Enrollment
Now let's understand how do we set up automated campaigns. To set up an
automated campaign, we come onto the campaign manager and select
automated. Now you will see a few pre-approved templates like this.
Let's say I select appointment reminder. I select this disclaimer
message and I click on "Use Template". This is wherein you can select
the trigger. So, say for example in this case, it's going to be based on
a date property. I'll select the appointment date, or the which in this
case could be date, and then when should the campaign start? Should the
campaign start on the date, before the date, after the date, or until
the date property value? So, in this case, let's say since this is an
appointment reminder, I'll say before the date property value. Two days,
and at what time? Let's say I'll say 12 p.m.. When to repeat? Only when
the day and month value matches. So, in this case, if at all I have an
appointment on the 15th, I'll get a reminder on the 13th at 12:00 p.m..
And then I can select a template message, and I can select the template
which talks about reminding me that I have an appointment in the next
two days. So, this is how you can set up automated campaigns. Automated
campaigns can also be set up based on what somebody has done or not
done, wherein you can actually select an integration. Or you can also
select it on the basis of segment addition. Let's talk about both of
these. So, in case of integration, let's say if I scroll down, let's
talk, let's imagine that this is one of the integrations that we have
done, and under that integration, this is one of the events that has
happened, let's say sign up. Right. So, now each time a sign up happens,
you can send out a templated message to the customer. You can also
filter this based on based on the payloads as well, where attribute
city, customer ID, or birth date. You can simply click on one of these
attributes and then customize it later on just for further filtration.
In terms of payloads, you can also set up a trigger as segment, wherein
I can say customer 360. And, say for example, each time a person gets
added to a specific segment, you want to enroll them into an automated
campaign. So, how can we do that? We say, "Select what someone has done
or not done". We select the source as customer 360. The condition is
"Added to segment". I can click on "Add Filter," and then I can select
the segment name like this. Now each time a person gets added into this
segment, a templated message can be sent out to this user. So, this is
how you set up automated campaigns. It is majorly used to cover use
cases like birthday wishes, appointment reminders, or any event based
triggers.

# Console overview
Hi there. This is a quick overview of the Gupshup console and its
capabilities. Gupshup is a tool which can help businesses with their
operations throughout the customer life cycle, whether it\'s lead
generation, whether it\'s a customer in the funnel and you\'re trying to
assist them to convert them, or whether it\'s an already existing
customer and you\'re trying to support them. Gupshup can help you
throughout the customer life cycle. And we have all the right tools
which are all mentioned on the left, which can be accessed from this
tab, which can help you support these operations.

## Platform Navigation
Starting off with the home page, where in you can see your WhatsApp
number, you can see the status, whether it\'s verified and live. You can
also see your ability to send messages, you can see the messaging limit,
you can see your quality rating, which basically tells about your
WhatsApp business health and how people are engaging with your messages.
You can see whether there are any template restrictions or not and how
many messages can go out within a second, allowed throughput. A few
numbers related to campaigns and automated campaigns, how many campaigns
are being done, what is the total number of messages that are being sent
and a shortcut to these modules as well. Personalize where in you can
see an overview of your customer data, how many total profiles are
there, how many total customers are there and how many of them are
active. And you can also see a bird\'s eye view of the total number of
